snippet: A collection of illegal virtual private networks, or VPNs, was successfully closed by Iran, making visits to Web sites deemed immoral or politically dangerous nearly impossible.
abstract: Iran's powerful Ministry of Information and Communications Technology block popular software used by millions of Iranians to bypass elaborate official Internet filtering system, stepping up campaign to gain more control over way Iranians use Internet.
lead_paragraph: A collection of illegal virtual private networks, or VPNs, was successfully closed by Iran, making visits to Web sites deemed immoral or politically dangerous nearly impossible.

headline.seo: Iran Blocks Software Used to Bypass Internet Filtering System
headline.main: Iran Blocks Way to Bypass Internet Filtering System
headline.print_headline: Iran Blocks Way to Bypass Internet Filtering System
